alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Windham County through 515 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over mainly rural areas of northern Windham County moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bellows Falls, Londonderry, Saxtons River, Westminster, Windham, Rockingham, Jamaica, Grafton, Athens, North Westminster, Brockways Mills, Rawsonville, South Windham, East Jamaica, Bartonsville, Thompsonburg, Cambridgeport, North Windham, Pikes Falls and Simpsonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
